comment.author: 41373397@N07
comment._content: The American Locomotive Company (ALCO) was licensed to build Garratts in the US, but never did so, at least not for any US railroad.  Just think how huge one might have been!

comment.author: 54450684@N02
comment._content: Its to bad that the garratts never came to america. It was a beautiful locomotive

comment.author: 41373397@N07
comment._content: ALCO built the Big Boys (4-8-8-4s) specifically for the Union Pacific RR in two orders, 1941 and 1944.  The UP was the only RR ever to have 4-8-8-4s.  I believe ALCO obtained the rights to the Garratt design years earlier.  Hence, no connection between the two.

comment.author: 47013386@N06
comment._content: i believe this was the first one delivered
